complaint_summary: Dismissal of employees during pendency of industrial dispute allegedly violating principles of natural justice and contravening Section 33 of the Industrial Disputes Act.
investigation_summary: The Labour Court adjudicated the dispute under Section 33-A of the Industrial Disputes Act, addressing allegations of contravention of Section 33 and dismissal of workmen for Trade Union activities.
judgment_summary: The Assam High Court held that the Labour Court erred in allowing the petition filed by the Union Secretary without proper authorization from the aggrieved workmen. The award was set aside, and the petition was allowed.
legal_arguments: Section 33-A requires determination of contravention of Section 33 before adjudicating merits.
Union cannot independently file a petition under Section 33-A without authorization from aggrieved workmen.
Dismissal of workmen during pendency of industrial dispute constitutes violation of natural justice.
citations: Equitable Coal Co., Ltd. v. Algu Singh (1957) 17 F J R 184
New India Motors Private Ltd., New Delhi v. K. T. Morris (1960) 19 F J R 8
Belur Iron and Steel Workers' Union, Belur v. Shyam Engineering Works (1952 Lab. A C 279)
Steel Brothers & Co., Ltd. v. Their Workmen (1954) 1 L L J 314
key_issues: Whether the Union Secretary was authorized to file a petition under Section 33-A.
Whether the dismissal of workmen violated Section 33 of the Industrial Disputes Act.
Whether the Labour Court erred in adjudicating preliminary and merits issues simultaneously.

legal_terms.Industrial Dispute: A dispute between employers and employees concerning employment terms.
legal_terms.Natural Justice: Legal principles ensuring fair treatment in judicial and administrative proceedings.

words_and_phrases.Contravention: Violation or breach of a law or regulation.
words_and_phrases.Aggrieved Workman: An employee adversely affected by an employer's action.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the dismissal of workmen during an industrial dispute, alleged contravention of Section 33 of the Industrial Disputes Act, and procedural errors by the Labour Court. The Assam High Court ruled that the Union Secretary's petition was invalid without proper authorization from the aggrieved workmen, setting aside the Labour Court's award.
